fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, long numeric value in Number Custom Field would be stored as Float in the Database. This allow the value to be stored in Exponent form, which is good in processing terms but not legible to users. When exporting the values, certain formats would export it as Integer while other as Float/Exponent form. The latter form could lead to problems if the tool is strictly reading it as raw/plaintext.

*Replication steps:*
# Create a Number Custom Field and add it into the Screen of a Project
# Create a new Issue in the Project and input a long numeric value (e.g.: 100000000000000) in the Number Custom Field
# In the created Issue, see the value displayed as 100,000,000,000,000
# Export the Issue (including the Number Custom Field) as different formats (CSV, XML, HTML)
# Below are the noticed outcome of opening the exported files:
|| | Exported as | Opened as | Rendered ||
|| | CSV | text file | 1.0E14 ||
|| | CSV | excel file | 100,000,000,000,000 ||
|| | XML | xml | 1.0E14 ||
|| | HTML | text file | 100,000,000,000,000 ||
|| | HTML | web page | 100,000,000,000,000 ||
*Note:* Despite the CSV export would have the numeric value in Exponent form, importing it into Jira would allow it to be stored properly in the database and displayed in full integer format in the Jira UI.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the Export tool to consistently export long numeric field as full integer format regardless of the format. The export tool should convert the Float format into Integer when exporting it.

h3. Workaround 
To avoid this, the long numeric values can be stored in Text Custom Field rather than the Number Custom Field. This would allow the numeric value to be stored as-is in the Database.
fields.summary: Ability to export long numeric values stored in Number Custom Field consistently as full integer format across export formats

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you use the Garbage-First (G1) garbage collector, we recommend configuring your JVM parameters to avoid the risk of explicit STW (stop the world) GC, which causes Jira to become unavailable while the garbage collection cycle runs.

See [Health Check: Explicit Garbage Collection|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/health-check-explicit-garbage-collection-976778100.html] for more details

h3. Suggested Solution
Add '-XX:+ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent' by default to Jira. 
* It will be used by G1GC and CMS. 
** https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8160392 
* It will be ignored by ParallelGC since there is no Concurrent phase for OldGen. 

Context:
bq. Other causes than Allocation Failure for a Full GC typically indicate that either the application or some external tool causes a full heap collection. If the cause is System.gc(), and there is no way to modify the application sources, the effect of Full GCs can be mitigated by using -XX:+ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent 
from https://docs.oracle.com/javase/9/gctuning/garbage-first-garbage-collector-tuning.htm#JSGCT-GUID-2428DA90-B93D-48E6-B336-A849ADF1C552

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Make ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent default for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the Cloud Formation Template will be periodically updated but while the template is updated on Github/Bitbucket site, it would not be reflected the already running stack that was deployed using an older template. This means that if there is any improvement or changes made in the new template, it would not affect those stacks.

Such information can't be found in the following:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/administering-jira-data-center-on-aws-938846969.html

h3. Suggested Solution
To have proper documentation on the steps to update those templates in which at the moment would be to deploy the new template and migrate the data from the previous template to the new one.

h3. Why this is important
The user would not understand this until they are not able to successfully update their template due to some changes over the Github/Bitbucket side. Also, when the template does not behave as expected after updating its values.
fields.summary: Documentation in updating the Cloud Formation Template of already running stack.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It appears that when one node is doing directory sync when it is completed, the timing ("Last synchronization at" )would only be updated on the node that is doing it. The other node would still use the time when is the last time they are doing the sync

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a Cluster with at least 2 nodes.
# Set up the cluster with External Directory.
# Manually sync the directory in one node (Node A).
# After a few minutes, sync it again in the other node (Node B).
# Check back the timing in the other node (Node A) after the last directory sync

h3. Expected Results
The Node will be updated with the latest directory sync timing that the cluster has done

h3. Actual Results
The Node will still retain the timing when the first time the sync happens.

h3. Workaround
Go to the *Scheduler details* administration page and search for the {{com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.JiraDirectoryPollerManager}} job.
Expanding the details of this job will show the actual time it was performed on any node of the cluster.
fields.summary: Last Directory Sync time is not updated on every node

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Specific to *Relates to* issue link, we have been able to identify that creating the issue link from the two different methods result in two different behavior:
 # From *More > Link* is always creating an Outward link.
 # From *Edit Issue* screen is always creating an Inward link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

In a Jira issue, creates two links to the same issue using the *Relates to* issue link
 # Create the first issue link from *More > Link*.
 # Create the second issue link from *Edit Issue* screen.
(Order is not important, as long as both links are created from these two methods)

h3. Expected Results

Jira should already detect the existing issue link in the database and should not create a reciprocal link.
h3. Actual Results

As for both methods Jira creates the link from different sources and destination, the second link is created.
 !bug-issuelink.png!
 For more context from the SQL logging:
 # First attempt via Edit Issue screen
{code:java}
2020-01-28 12:54:37,600 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-39 akmal 774x95850x1 199zffd /secure/QuickEditIssue.jspa 16ms "SELECT ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE FROM dbo.issuelink WHERE DESTINATION='10000'" 2020-01-28 12:54:37,771 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-39 akmal 774x95850x1 199zffd /secure/QuickEditIssue.jspa 0ms "SELECT ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE FROM dbo.issuelink WHERE SOURCE='10001'" 2020-01-28 12:54:37,771 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-39 akmal 774x95850x1 199zffd /secure/QuickEditIssue.jspa 0ms "INSERT INTO dbo.issuelink (ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE) VALUES ('10309', '10003', '10001', '10000','null')"  {code}
 # Second attempt via More > Link
{code:java}
2020-01-28 13:07:01,567 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-32 akmal 787x96053x1 spxuuf /secure/LinkJiraIssue.jspa 0ms "SELECT ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE FROM dbo.issuelink WHERE DESTINATION='10000'"
2020-01-28 13:07:01,673 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-32 akmal 787x96053x1 spxuuf /secure/LinkJiraIssue.jspa 0ms "SELECT ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE FROM dbo.issuelink WHERE SOURCE='10000'"
2020-01-28 13:07:01,673 https-jsse-nio-443-exec-32 akmal 787x96053x1 spxuuf /secure/LinkJiraIssue.jspa 0ms "INSERT INTO dbo.issuelink (ID, LINKTYPE, SOURCE, DESTINATION, SEQUENCE) VALUES ('10310', '10003', '10000', '10001', 'null')"{code}
This will create a duplicate link for the Relates to issue linking because it has the same name for both inward and outward link
{code:sql}
jira=# select * from issuelinktype where linkname = 'Relates';
  id   | linkname |   inward   |  outward   | pstyle 
-------+----------+------------+------------+--------
 10003 | Relates  | relates to | relates to | 
(1 row)
{code}
And in the DB we see this is actually two different links
{code:sql}
jira=# select * from issuelink order by id desc limit 2;
  id   | linktype | source | destination | sequence 
-------+----------+--------+-------------+----------
 10310 |    10003 |  10000 |       10001 |         
 10309 |    10003 |  10001 |       10000 |         
(2 rows){code}

h3. Workaround

Currently no workaround is available.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior when creating a Relates to issue link
Add 'summary' as an accepted field to the jira.view.issue.links.sort.order property

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Whenever a hyperlink is pasted on the Visual tab of the comments session, it breaks the syntax of the external link button.

h3. Suggested Solution
Visual editor should interpret the hyperlink and avoid the double brackets when using the external link button.

h3. Workaround
To avoid this behavior, if using the Visual mode, we can paste the URL as plain text, for example using the command CTRL+SHIFT+V.
fields.summary: Pasting hyperlink on Visual tab comments breaks the external link syntaxe.

fields.description: As a Jira Admin, I'd like to see the 'Print Cards' option under the 'Board' menu dropdown enhanced. Right now the choices are 'Small, Medium, and Large'. It would be great if there was an option (also) for placing cards into standard Avery Label templates. I would think a relatively small number of these would suffice.
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin I would like to print cards using Avery Label templates.

fields.description: Comment properties in Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center before version 7.13.12, from 8.0.0 before version 8.5.4, and 8.6.0 before version 8.6.1 allows remote attackers to make comments on a ticket to which they do not have commenting permissions via a broken access control bug.
fields.summary: Jira Server Comment Permissions Broken Access Control Bug -  CVE-2019-20106

fields.description: When searching through JQL, the [SLA field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-ApprovalsSLA] does not have option to filter tickets what exceeded a certain SLA when the SLA is no longer active. The retroactive options of "breached" and "everbreached" do not allow a variable to tune the search results to a breach time. This would be useful for reporting on tickets that exceed certain SLA thresholds.
fields.summary: JQL Search by time breached

fields.description: Since Portfolio for Jira is dependent on Rank, it would be very beneficial to have this as its own permission, separate from Schedule and Edit.
fields.summary: Add Rank to Permission Scheme

fields.description:
Hello, 

One of our customer needs Jira and would like to monitor his project costs month per month such as budget, deviation calculation, finance reporting... 

The goal is to have like an estimation of budget at the beginning and being able to follow the project costs deviations each month. 

My questions are the followings:
 * Would Big Picture plugin be adapted for this kind of monitoring ?
 * What would you preconize for this kind of monitoring and reporting ? 

Thank you
fields.summary: Monitoring project costs and deviation in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User is trying to move issues from one project to another(bulk move). On moving, the issue id changes to some random number. The issue id not following any sequence order.

h3. Suggested Solution
User expects the issue id to be the same unless the same issue id is present in the target project or some order
fields.summary: Issue ID changes after moving between projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When there are issues with thousands of comments, a user can expect bad performance from that issue. Looking into the queries, the following query is run everytime there is a new comment on the issue : 
{code}SELECT ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, rolelevel, actionbody, CREATED, UPDATEAUTHOR, UPDATED, actionnum FROM jiraaction WHERE issueid=216730 AND actiontype='comment' ORDER BY CREATED ASC LIMIT 1 ;{code}
Looks like the query is being indexed by 'CREATED' however this column does not have an index on it.

h3. Suggested Solution
If the query is changed to order by 'ID' then we get much better query performance : 
{code}EXPLAIN SELECT ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, rolelevel, actionbody, CREATED, UPDATEAUTHOR, UPDATED, actionnum FROM jiraaction WHERE issueid=216730 AND actiontype='comment' ORDER BY ID DESC LIMIT 1 ;{code}  
This change speeds the query up by a factor of x20.
fields.summary: Select query optimisation to improve performance for issues with large number of comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on the Project filter drop-down on the Custom Field Admin page (ViewCustomFields.jspa) results in a spinning icon and can take seconds to render the actual project results. The performance of the drop-down loading degrades as the number of projects increase. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 1500+ projects in a Jira Software instance. 
 # Navigate to Custom Fields (ViewCustomFields.jspa) and click the Project drop-down. 

h3. Expected Results

The menu loads immediately (or very quickly) with the list of projects. 
h3. Actual Results

The menu shows only a spinning icon for a second or more until all the data is rendered. The performance of the drop-down degrades as the number of projects increase. 

Image of 'spinning' icon:

  !Image 2020-01-24 at 2.47.25 PM.png|width=649,height=207!
* Clicking the main Project menu - projects are populated very quickly. 
* Attached har file shows a 4.41 s load time in an instance with 5000+ projects.
* Drop-down uses data from the {{/rest/api/2/project}} call, so it's slow due to slow execution of the REST API. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Project filter drop-down on ViewCustomFields.jspa loads slowly and displays only a spinning icon until fully populated

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
According to [Permissions overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver0713/permissions-overview-965543151.html] documentation, the board administrators with *Project Admin* permission are able to create and delete statuses only in Simplified Workflows, and we'd like to stop that without having to revoke the board administrator's permission.

h3. Suggested Solution
In case that the extended permission is disabled, create the ability to revoke the creation of status permission from board administrators.

h3. Workaround 
Revoke the board administrator's permission from the user.
fields.summary: Ability to revoke create status permission of the board administrator.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a visually impaired user failed to login to Jira, they will be presented with a CAPTCHA to reset the login, however, as the captcha method uses an image is used to verify if the user is a real user/spambot, it can't be read by screenreaders/viewed by the visually impaired.

Due to that, we would like for different alternatives to replace CAPTCHA feature for verification instead such as : 
 * A generic maths question such as 5 + 2 = ?
 * Audio Captcha

This will be very helpful in increasing the accessibility of Jira.
fields.summary: Add alternative options to test verification instead of CAPTCHA so it would be more accessible to all Jira users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As an admin, I’d like the ability to check the consistency of the *searchrequest* Lucene index between nodes

Missing filters observed when the index files were corrupted or outdated in any of the nodes.

The issue has been resolved when the index file moved from the working node to the problematic node.

 
h3. Expecting

Client would want to have the ability to check the consistency of filters in each node before the user reported the issue. (like the issue count we check using REST API between nodes)
fields.summary: As an admin, I’d like the ability to check the consistency of the *searchrequest* Lucene index between nodes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment, a user directory can be changed and there are no audit logs for the changes. If someone changes a user directory there should be a line logged such as:

'User XX changed User Directory YY'
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Administration -> User Directory
 # Click disable on one of the directories.
 # check the audit logs

h3. Expected Results

There should be a line in the logs when you click disable before the directory is actually disabled.
h3. Actual Results

There is no log.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Audit trail for changes to User Directory.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At the moment, a user directory can be disabled and there is no confirmation dialog. If you disable a user directory, this will immediately disable the directory and prevent users from accessing Jira.  It is easy to do so accidentally.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Administration -> User Directory
 # Click disable on one of the directories.

h3. Expected Results

There should be a confirmation dialog when you click disable before the directory is actually disabled.
h3. Actual Results

There is no confirmation.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Confirmation on disabling user directory.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if the [-Dhttp.nonProxyHosts in catalina.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-server-ignores-http-nonproxyhosts-jvm-option-214863640.html] has an extra space after the value, then during startup many Jira functionalities will not work correctly and you will get the following error in the logs: 
{code}
Caused by: org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Failed to instantiate [com.atlassian.httpclient.api.HttpClient]: Factory method 'create' threw exception; nested exception is java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "3312 "
{code}
where 3312 was the value of -Dhttp.nonProxyHosts


h3. Suggested Solution

Jira should trim the value for any spaces before using it to prevent such issues.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like -Dhttp.nonProxyHosts's value in catalina.properties to trim any space characters beside it

fields.description: Some teams are using the kanban backlog feature and are really enjoying it - but needing to add a new status to the workflow in order to use it is too much complexity for other projects that use simple To Do - In Progress - Done workflows. Instead, we would like to use rank to display the top items on the board, and the rest in the backlog. Allowing a custom filter to define the backlog would also work, but rank seems like it would be cleaner. This would also help with especially slow kanban boards that have too many cards on them.
fields.summary: Base the kanban backlog on rank or something other than status

fields.description:
h3.Issue Summary

Extra non-ascii character is shown at the error message when user input wrong/no value on the "Edit version" screen.
The behavior is seen in 8.6.1.

h3.Steps to Reproduce

Navigate to the Project settings >> Versions
Create a new version and edit the entry
In the edit window, enter "Empty" value for Name 
An error will be seen "You must specify a valid version name" with additional non-ascii character at the end of the error (a Square box).
This is the same behavior for Date error message

h3.Expected Results
The error message should not have non-ascii character

h3.Actual Results
Please refer to the attachment

!non-ascii character error.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Extra non-ascii character in the Error message

fields.description:
When planning to run JIRA over a container-orchestration system like kubernetes - typically containers in kubernetes write to STDOUT from there the data is captured and sent to log solution like elastic search.

I understand that in the case of jira we use persistent volumes where log files are stored - but this makes it harder to be peaked up by standard cluster log tools. 

As a way to achieve something like this, an option is to use a "sidecar" (see [https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/cluster-administration/logging/#using-a-sidecar-container-with-the-logging-agent]) but please consider enabling such re-routing to the relevant engineering team working on containers for JIRA to be more aligned with Cloud mainstream direction.
fields.summary: Add a user-friendly way to route Jira application logging to  STDOUT/STDERR instead of log files

fields.description:
*Suggestion Summary:*

With current structure of schema documentation it is very difficult for admins/users to determine the schema changes across versions. Documentation does not point out changes if any except laying out entire schema structure.

Can we make changes across version to be bolded out, or whichever mechanism makes it visible outright to admins/users referring the doc.
fields.summary: Schema documentation does not specifically points out the difference in schemas across versions

fields.description: The Application links plugin used in Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center before version 7.13.12, from version 8.0.0 before version 8.5.4 and from version 8.6.0 before version 8.6.1 allows remote attackers with administrator privileges to edit existing applinks without passing WebSudo via an improper authorization check. See https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/APL-1391 for more details.
fields.summary: Improper Authorization in Applinks - CVE-2019-20105

fields.description: It would be great if we had the ability to schedule the Jira release to be automatically triggered after a number of days (weekly, monthly, etc). Today, we can set the release date for a version, however, it will not enforce the release.
fields.summary: Add the ability to schedule the release of version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Any update actions on custom fields value during the deletion process of the same issue can cause that thread to be stuck on the database. This could cause the delete transaction and thread to run indefinitely or delete operation will be rolledback, this can also cause deadlocks any type of databases. 
 The issue is therefore never deleted and eventually, you will get a timeout message in the GUI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install CPrime Power Script Plugin - the script is necessary to trigger custom field update action,
 # Create new "Number Field" custom field,
 # Create SIL scripts which edit new custom field:
 # Create synchronous SIL listener on Issue Link Delete Event
 # Create issue A and B,
 # Set on both the custom field value,
 # Link issue A to B - A blocks B
 # Remove issue A.

SIL Script example
{code:java}
customfield_10108=1;{code}
h3. (!) This can occur when using any scripted function that attempts to update the parent issue that is deleted, Script Runner etc. 
h3. Expected Results

Issue A is deleted.
h3. Actual Results

Issue A persist

*Before database connections are terminated:*
 Two stuck connections on a database, originating from the same transaction

!6.png!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Disabled users show up in auto-suggest in certain cases while commenting the issue
h3. Steps to Reproduce
I have been able to reproduce in Jira 8.4.2 and 7.13 the following:

* disable a user from user management
** If the user is the assignee of the issue, @mention while commenting will list this user account, even when the user is disabled.
** If the user has commented on the issue, @mention while commenting will list this user account, even when the user is disabled.
** If the page is not refreshed after disabling the account, @mention while commenting will continue to list the user account, even when the user is disabled.

h3. Expected Results

the disabled user should be not available in auto-suggest

h3. Actual Results

the disabled user is suggested in the scenarios described above

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Disabled users show up in mentioning auto-suggest in certain cases while commenting the issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Under high load, there could be performance degradation of requests using {{CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore}} cache while loading the data and populating the values. This is due to contention in cache internals. {{CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore}} is used a cache for {{propertyentry}} table. If DB performance is low, that affects loading the values into the cache, increasing the contention. 

h3. Environment
* Datacenter 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Apply high load to put {{CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore}} cache under pressure.
# Start updating different elements of the cache (some examples):
#* Update user locale
#* Last login time (see JRASERVER-70468)
#* Dismissed banners 

h3. Expected Results
READ and UPDATE operations for a different part of the cache (different keys) can run concurrently without blocking each other. 

h3. Actual Results
READ and UPDATE operations for a different part of the cache (different keys) both in WAITING state waiting for the same lock (in the same stripe). So updates are blocking reads for other keys.   

 
h3. Notes
A typical symptom of the problem: 
* Large (majority) of the threads are waiting while executing {{CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.resolve}} 
* at the same time and same lock:
** Updates on some elements of the cache in {{CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.setEntry}} method. 
*** (i) Updates from other nodes from cluster add to the contentions, eg:
{noformat}
[c.a.j.c.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheOpReader] LocalQCacheOp{cacheName='com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.cache', action=REMOVE, key=CacheKey[entityName=ApplicationUser,entityId=16782], value=null, creationTimeInMillis=1561687285335} 
{noformat}
** or loading cache in {{CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.loadPropertySetData}}. If loading the cache is slow due to DB problems, that will worsen the situation. 

+Example from the thread dump:+
*  70%+ threads are in WAITING state in the _CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.resolve_ method
* Different threads reading different values from the same cache but blocked on the same lock - 0x0000000085534e48:
* _getCustomFieldNameTranslation_ - READ
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-541" #3540942 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f7b980d2800 nid=0xa43d waiting on condition [0x00007f75ffead000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000085534e48> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
....
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.get(DeferredReplicationCache.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.resolve(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.getEntry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:123)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertySet.get(CachingOfBizPropertySet.java:189)
	at com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.AbstractPropertySet.getString(AbstractPropertySet.java:305)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.translation.TranslationManagerImpl.getCustomFieldNameTranslation(TranslationManagerImpl.java:229)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.translation.TranslationManagerImpl.getCustomFieldNameTranslation(TranslationManagerImpl.java:222)
{noformat}
* _removeDismissFlagForUser_ - UPDATE
{noformat}
"http-nio-8080-exec-547" #3540948 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f7b980da000 nid=0xa445 waiting on condition [0x00007f75fceab000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000085534e48> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$NonfairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$WriteLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:943)
	at net.sf.ehcache.concurrent.ReadWriteLockSync.lock(ReadWriteLockSync.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.remove(LoadingCache.java:191)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.remove(DelegatingCache.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.lambda$remove$2(DeferredReplicationCache.java:74)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache$$Lambda$476/1199143721.get(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.runDeferred(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCache.remove(DeferredReplicationCache.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.invalidateCacheEntry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:239)
	at com.atlassian.jira.propertyset.CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.setEntry(CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore.java:142)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.flag.FlagDismissalServiceImpl.removeDismissFlagForUser(FlagDismissalServiceImpl.java:44)
{noformat}

Example rows from {{propertyentry}} table:
{noformat}
select * from propertyentry where entity_name = 'jira.properties' limit 2;
  id   |   entity_name   | entity_id |       property_key                             | propertytype
 10209 | jira.properties |         1 | jira.path.attachments                       | 5
 10210 | jira.properties |         1 | jira.path.attachments.use.default.directory | 1
 10211 | jira.properties |         1 | jira.option.allowattachments                | 1
 10213 | jira.properties |         1 | jira.path.backup                            | 5
...
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
* Way to reduce the impact - increase the number of stripes in Ehcache to significantly low down the chance of collusion, see  JRASERVER-70518
fields.summary: Performance degradation due to contention in CachingOfBizPropertyEntryStore cache

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira Datacenter uses _EHCache_ as a cache implementation with a local wrapper {{LoadingCache}} (com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache), which is configured by default with a low number of stripes (mutexes).

In some cases, we see a very large contention inside the cache due to cross locking of different keys in the same stripe of the cache.
 * Due to low number of stripes (64) there is a high chance of collision in the same stripe for large caches.
 * End-users observed a performance degradation. Response time spikes are accumulated because of threads are waiting and not being able to utilize the hardware during that time.

+Details+:
 * EhCache protects cache consistency by having a read/write lock for data per stripe (segment). It’s not as granular as by keys (!)
 * Reads/Writes to the same stripe will share the same lock, so reads for Key-A might be blocked by writes for Key-B if they are in the same segment.
 * In Atlassian cache wrapper we have 64 stripes. The default number of stripes in EhCache is 2048 (DEFAULT_NUMBER_OF_MUTEXES) which will allow higher concurrency and low chance of collision.

h3. Suggested Solution

Increase number of stripes (NUMBER_OF_MUTEXES).

Related code from {{net.sf.ehcache.concurrent.StripedReadWriteLockSync#getSyncForKey}}
{code:java}
 /**
     * The default number of locks to use. Must be a power of 2.
     * <p/>
     * The choice of 2048 enables 2048 concurrent operations per cache or cache store, which should be enough for most
     * uses.
     */
    public static final int DEFAULT_NUMBER_OF_MUTEXES = 2048;
    private final ReadWriteLockSync[] mutexes;
...
{code}
See related - [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CACHE-234]
h3. Workaround

Manually increase the number of stripes in EHCache. Add to JVM args:
{code:java}
JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=" $JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS -Dcom.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.DEFAULT_NUMBER_OF_MUTEXES=2048 "
{code}
fields.summary: Increase number of cache stripes for EHCache cache

h3. Problem Definition
Some parts of Jira application do not fully support HTTP/2 yet. 

For example, the header lowercase requirement. This can break the Application link status checks.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have Jira application to support HTTP/2 protocol

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding the Confluence pages gadget to a Jira dashboard twice, will cause Jira to fail the authentication on the second gadget upon the auto-refresh if other gadgets are present on the dashboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the Confluence Pages gadget twice to a dashboard.
 # Configure it to auto-refresh after 15 minutes.
 # Add other gadgets to the dashboard.
 # Wait for the gadgets to auto-refresh.

h3. Expected Results

The dashboard should update both Confluence Pages gadgets and display the linked pages.
h3. Actual Results

The first gadget does authenticate correctly and updates its contents, but the second gadget instance fails to authenticate.
h3. Workaround

Don't add other gadgets to the same dashboard.
fields.summary: Adding the Confluence Pages gadget twice in a dashboard causes the second gadget to fail the authentication with Confluence

h3. Issue Summary

Creating a Service Desk project via CSV using the External System Import feature results in a corrupted Service Desk project being created. The sidebar will not have Queues, Customers, Reports etc.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using Jira's [external system import |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html]
 # Import [^test project type.csv]
 # Map the fields accordingly.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will create a Service Desk Project successfully.
h3. Actual Results

Jira will create a corrupted Service Desk project as seen below.
 !Project 3.png!
h3. Workaround

Create a project manually via Jira.
fields.summary: Creating a Service Desk project via CSV using the External System Import feature results in a corrupted Service Desk project being created. The sidebar will not have Queues, Customers, Reports etc.

fields.description:
h4. Summary
When Jira is starting up, it scans spring annotations for plugin classes. As part of this scanning process, it tries to ensure that these spring annotation classes are contained only in single jar. Responsible class for this action is AtlassianScannerBeanDefinitionParser. 

If for some reason plugin can see spring annotations from another plugin that bundled them, plugin initialisation fails with error

{noformat:borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#6A8EB3 |bgColor=#F8F8F8}
2019-06-24 19:17:52,028 ThreadPoolAsyncTaskExecutor::Thread 28 ERROR      [c.a.p.osgi.factory.OsgiPlugin] Unable to start the plugin container for plugin 'com.radiantminds.roadmaps-jira'
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanDefinitionStoreException: Unexpected exception parsing XML document from URL [bundle://263.0:0/META-INF/spring/portfolio-root-context.xml]; nested exception is java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot execute atlassian-spring-scanner-runtime: plugin has an extra copy of atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation classes, perhaps embedded inside the target plugin 'com.radiantminds.roadmaps-jira'; embedding scanner-annotations is not supported since scanner version 2.0. Use 'mvn dependency:tree' and ensure the atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation dependency in your plugin has <scope>provided</scope>, not 'runtime' or 'compile', and you have NO dependency on atlassian-spring-scanner-runtime.
{noformat}

The problem here is that plugins from error message have nothing to do with bundling spring scanner. Because of OSGI non-deterministic wiring, these bundles see spring annotation from 'wrong' bundle.

(!) Note: Default Jira installation doesn't have this problem. All bundled plugins are compatible (/). 

h4. Cause
What is causing these errors is the fact that some of the plugins use 2.x version of {{atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation}} dependency in a wrong way.
Plugins are known to have this problem:
* de.demicon - Image custom field, fixed in latest version (/)
* de.demicon - Field converter, fixed in latest version (/)
* Customfield editor plugin v 2.5.0, fixed in 2.5.1 (/)


h4. Expected scenario
All of the plugins which use 2.x version of {{atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation}} should be fixed. They should use <provided> scope instead of <compile> or <runtime>. After new versions of these plugins are released, they should be used in Jira.
Instructions on upgrading can be found at [atlassian-spring-scanner ReadMe|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-spring-scanner/src/master/]

h4. Note
(i) How to find the plugin with {{atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation}}.
# Since Spring Scanner v2 classes should not be bundled, you can find reduce the scope of suspected plugins by running the following on:
#* JARs in the current directory (such as $JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins) as follows:
{code}
for i in *.jar; do unzip -v $i | sed "s/^/$i:/" | grep com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/; done
{code}
In my case, this returns the name of the offending JAR:
{code}
jira-greenhopper-plugin-7.13.0-DAILY20190329134024.jar:       0  Stored        0   0% 08-21-2014 06:30 00000000  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/
jira-greenhopper-plugin-7.13.0-DAILY20190329134024.jar:     422  Defl:N      257  39% 08-21-2014 06:30 28d693c1  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/Scanned.class
jira-greenhopper-plugin-7.13.0-DAILY20190329134024.jar:     731  Defl:N      394  46% 08-21-2014 06:30 345abc0d  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/ConfluenceComponent.class
...
tomcat-filter-0.3.1.jar:       0  Stored        0   0% 06-21-2019 16:25 00000000  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/
tomcat-filter-0.3.1.jar:     574  Defl:N      343  40% 05-14-2019 05:35 285fa055  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/ClasspathComponent.class
tomcat-filter-0.3.1.jar:     728  Defl:N      396  46% 05-14-2019 05:35 6cd2cf1f  com/atlassian/plugin/spring/scanner/annotation/component/BitbucketComponent.class
...
{code}
# Verify with the source code (pom.xml) which _atlassian-spring-scanner-annotation_ is used. 
#* In case of V1.x those files are expected 
#* In case of V2.x mentioned plugin will cause the problem, in this specific case - tomcat-filter-0.3.1.jar. 

h4. Potential Workaround
# For any plugin that failed to start, go to the 'Manage Add-Ons' page in Jira and attempt to manually enable the plugin.
# Re-start Jira, and the race condition may not be triggered
fields.summary: Jira will fail to start plugins due to spring scanner library problem v.2 in some plugins

fields.description:
Currently, when a Jira admin exports an XML from a Jira instance A and imports it to a target Jira instance B where some of the statuses are not available to be used in the imported workflow, it will cause the following issue in the Jira instance:
- [Jira Errors due to non-existing status|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-errors-due-to-non-existing-status-955176883.html]

As a Jira admin exporting workflows to a target instance, it would be great and would avoid unexpected issues if those missing statuses were created and mapped during the automatically during the import.
fields.summary: Importing a Workflow from XML should automatically create missing status
Provide configurable API rate limiting to the REST API

h3. Issue Summary

We would like to create a new Jira administrator group that only can manage the users in specific.

h3. Actual Results

Until now, only the system administrator can manage the users on Jira. Together with the user management, they will have access to all settings from Jira and we wanted to limit the access.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User management Administrator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attempting to edit/create an issue where there is a multi-user picker field with inactive users, an ERROR appears and I am not able to perform the edit/create action.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h4. Scenario #1
 # Create a multi-user picker custom field, disable the filtering for it (JRASERVER-40963) and add it to create and edit screens.
 # Create a user.
 # Create an issue and set the custom field to this user.
 # Under _Administration>User management_, click on *Edit* next to the new user and uncheck the *Active* box.
 # Try to edit the issue created in step 3 (any field).

h4. Scenario #2
# Create multi-user picker custom field > set this as global context (all projects, all issue types)
#* Do not associate this with any screens.
# Set default value to a specific user, let's say *userone*
# Set *userone* as inactive
# Create an issue in any project


h3. Expected Results

Should be able to edit and create the issue.

h3. Actual Results

You'll receive an ERROR mentioning *"User 'x' is not valid for this user picker"* and you'll not be able to edit the issue (see attached screenshot).
!Screen Shot 2020-01-20 at 4.40.20 PM.png|width=197,height=98!

h3. Workaround #1
The workaround, for now, is to re-activate the user in question, make sure they are not granted any application access to not impact the number of users for the license. Under _Administration>User management_, click on *Edit* next to the new user and check the *Active* box.

h3. Workaround #2
Remove the inactive user from the field.
fields.summary: Error when creating/editing an issue with inactive users in multi-user picker field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The clustering monitoring page does not work in case the node name has colon ":" character hence not providing CPU/Memory/Uptime information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy JIRA Datacenter 8.6.1
# In the cluster.properties file, add the node name (jira.node.id) as "test:1234"

h3. Expected Results
* CPU/Memory/Uptime information to be displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-17 at 18.33.02.png! 

h3. Actual Results
* CPU/Memory/Uptime information *is not displayed*:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-17 at 18.27.12.png! 

h3. Note
Scope of the problem: 
* The existing _Jira quick start_ (https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira/) does not have this issue.
* only affects _quick start deployments_ that were deployed before the _4th of June last year_
* or customers who are _deploying with CloudFormation_ from this repository: https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/master/. 

h3. Workaround
* Remove the colon character ":" from the node name (jira.node.id in cluster.properties file).
fields.summary: Cluster monitoring does not work when node name has colon ":" character

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding log work during transition screen will silently failed for incoming transition if the status has  {{*jira.permission.work.denied*}} enabled.

As mention in this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-restrict-log-work-on-a-specific-status-834225982.html] we can restrict user from logging work by adding {{*jira.permission.work.denied*}} parameter to the specific status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create new simple project with simple workflow as below:
 !Workflow - BB_ Project Management Workflow - Jira - Google Chrome 2020-01-20 11.19.31.png|thumbnail! 
# Make sure the workflow has both transition:
#* *TO DO -> IN PROGRESS*
#* *IN PROGRESS -> TO DO*
# Create a new screen with Log work field
 !Configure Screen - Jira - Google Chrome 2020-01-20 11.22.13.png|thumbnail!
# Associate the Screen into the both transition form step 2:
 !Workflow - BB_ Project Management Workflow - Jira - Google Chrome 2020-01-20 11.23.31.png|thumbnail!  !Workflow - BB_ Project Management Workflow - Jira - Google Chrome 2020-01-20 11.24.15.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on *TO DO* status > On Options > Click Properties > Add below properties:
 !How to restrict Log Work on a specific status - Atlassian Documentation - Google Chrome 2020-01-20 11.25.47.png|thumbnail!
# Go to the project > Create one new issue and transition from *TO DO -> IN PROGRESS*.
# In *IN PROGRESS*, transition back the issue to *TO DO* status.
# On Transition screen, add *1 hour* as *Time spent* > Transition back to *TO DO*.
 !To do - Jira - Google Chrome 2020-01-20 11.31.34.png|thumbnail!
# Go to History tab on the issue > The time spent is not added in the JIRA issue history.
 ![BB-1] Test issue_ - Jira - Google Chrome 2020-01-20 11.34.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
*Time Spent* get added to the History tab and database. 

h3. Actual Results
Due to the default Post function for the transition, JIRA will set the workflow status first from *IN PROGRESS -> TO DO* (Step 1) before Update change history for and issue (Step 3) which will result the Time spent did not get updated due to {{*jira.permission.work.denied*}} properties in *TO DO* status:
 !Photos 2020-01-20 11.38.33.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA stores all data related to users including inactive users. The data is including emails, reported an issue, assigned issues, log work and more. GDPR (European Data Protection) includes *Right to be Forgotten* option which should allow JIRA Administrator to remove all data related to the user.

Currently, JIRA does not have a feature like this and Administrator will have to manually delete the user or bulk actions to disassociate data from the specific user.


h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce tool in JIRA to disassociate all data from inactive users to an anonymous user.


h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Anonymize use activity news

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Under the supported browser section in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html]
{quote}
h2. Browsers
*Desktop browsers:*

 Chrome (latest stable version)

 Microsoft Edge 

 Mozilla Firefox (latest stable version) 

 Safari on Mac OS X only (latest stable version)
{quote}

 !edgestableyn.png|thumbnail! 

All the browsers here note (latest stable version), except for Edge.  That is likely because Edge was still in the preview version, but that has just changed this week.  Details in https://blogs.windows.com/windowsexperience/2020/01/15/new-year-new-browser-the-new-microsoft-edge-is-out-of-preview-and-now-available-for-download/

h3. Suggested solution
Since Edge is now out of preview, we should likely change this to have it fall in line with the other browsers.  Or perhaps change all browsers to simply note that we only support the latest stable versions of each.

h3. Why this is important
Reading the supported platforms today makes it appear as if all versions of Edge ever created would be supported within Jira Server.  And that seems misleading to end users.  We should be more explicit about managing that customer expectation here.
fields.summary: Supported platforms documentation update request: Edge browser stable releases

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Users would like to see these additional features to be implemented in Jira Mail handlers.
 * The mail handler for jira should have the feature to scan and process only unread emails.
 * In addition, offer flexibility for users to configure the mail handler to process the emails starting from a specific date.
 * Currently Imap mail handler is deleting the processed emails, which is not working as per documentation. This may be a related issue (Issue Report: JRASERVER-67745).

h4. Business Reason:
 * This is resulting in problems where new users would like to use mail handlers but at the same time would stick to use the standard Inbox without migrating old issues.
 * Same is applicable when organizations would like to use the old email boxes, but would like to process only recent data post configuration of mail handlers.

h4. Current Implementation:  
 * Current implementation for incoming mail handler, processing all (read/unread) emails from the inbox (or specific folder) and creates ticket or add comments.
fields.summary: The incoming mail handler in jira should have the feature to create issues only for unread emails, and also give flexibility for users to configure to process the emails starting from a specific date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73683].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Chrome version 80 is set to ship in February 2020. With this release there are some new cookie security features coming that will force Chrome clients to enforce a SameSite check policy. Right now, this policy would break all the functionality of issue collectors that appear on separate domains.
 If the issue collector could set the SameSite=None in the cookie it appears that it could at least allow the issue collectors to work on different sites.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Inside a Chrome browser, go to address of chrome://flags and find entry called 'SameSite by default cookies' change this from default to Enabled (this feature is expected to ship in official Chrome 80 version on by default, hence this is something we should look to support, even if this specific version is not yet officially supported).
 # Then in my Jira Cloud site, I created a new issue collector
 # Copy the javascript of the issue collector and enter it into a site on a different domain

h3. Expected Results

Issue collector works as expected.
h3. Actual Results

Issue collector does not work. When the user click the expand button, they are presented with an error asking them to enable 3rd party cookies

!issuecollectorChromeSamesite.png|thumbnail!
{code:java}
We noticed that you have third-party cookies disabled in your browser. We need this enabled to correctly submit your feedback. Once youve enabled cookies, please refresh the page. 
{code}
The browser console log has an info message of
{code:java}
A cookie associated with a cross-site resource at <URL> was set without the `SameSite` attribute. It has been blocked, as Chrome now only delivers cookies with cross-site requests if they are set with `SameSite=None` and `Secure`. You can review cookies in developer tools under Application>Storage>Cookies and see more details at <URL> and <URL>.
Dashboard.jspa:1 A cookie associated with a cross-site resource at http://atlassian.net/ was set without the `SameSite` attribute. It has been blocked, as Chrome now only delivers cookies with cross-site requests if they are set with `SameSite=None` and `Secure`. You can review cookies in developer tools under Application>Storage>Cookies and see more details at https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5088147346030592 and https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5633521622188032. 
{code}
h3. Notes:

This feature can be enabled on most modern versions of Chrome such as 79.0.3945.117 (my current version) and also within Canary versions such as Version 81.0.4029.0 (Official Build) canary (64-bit). 
 The expectation though is that Chrome will implement this feature as on by default when a stable version of v80 is released. [https://blog.chromium.org/2019/10/developers-get-ready-for-new.html] explains this further.
{quote}Mozilla has affirmed their support of the new cookie classification model with their [intent to implement|https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/mozilla.dev.platform/nx2uP0CzA9k/BNVPWDHsAQAJ] the *_SameSite=None; Secure_* requirements for cross-site cookies in Firefox. Microsoft recently [announced|https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/#!msg/blink-dev/AknSSyQTGYs/8lMmI5DwEAAJ] plans to begin implementing the model starting as an experiment in Microsoft Edge 80.
{quote}
h3. Note on Fix

XSRF token check was disabled for this API:
{quote}You don’t have to enable 3rd party cookies to make the issue collector work. We’ve removed this requirement, also dropping some error messages that reminded about it.
{quote}
from [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-7-x-upgrade-notes-987138245.html]
 and [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-5-x-upgrade-notes-976781036.html]
h3. Workaround
 # In Chrome you could go to chrome://flags
 # Find the entry for 'SameSite by default cookies'
 # Set this to Disabled
 # Relaunch Chrome
fields.summary: Issue Collectors won't work for clients using Chrome 80 which enables new samesite cookie controls

fields.description:
Let's take an example that you have a long list of custom fields which spans across 10 pages. And you want to browse through the list to clean up unused fields. Now you are in page 5, and want to delete a field from that list. 

You click the gear button and select Delete (for example). A confirmation screen is shown, and after confirming, the field is deleted, but the list is refreshed and now put me back to page 1 of the list again. 

And now, I have to find my way back to page 5 and to the point of the next field after the field that I have deleted, to continue the work.

This happens to any administrator's lists (of workflows, workflow schemes, screens, custom fields ...), in some case I was in the Inactive list section, I will have to even expand the Inactive list again and again after each deletion of an Inactive workflow.
fields.summary: Stay at the current page after performing an action in workflows, workflow schemes, screens, custom fields pages

h3. Issue Summary

The recently disclosed vulnerabilities regarding Apache Tomcat
 * [CVE-2019-12418|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-12418]
 * [CVE-2019-17563|https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-17563]

Which affects the following versions:

* Apache Tomcat 8.x from 8.5.0 before 8.5.50



We should bundle a more recent version of Tomcat so that Jira is not affected by this in the future.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Not applicable.

h3. Expected Results
 * Not applicable.

h3. Actual Results
 * Not applicable.

h3. Workaround
 * Manually upgrade Tomcat according to our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-used-by-jira-879957866.html].
fields.summary: Upgrade Tomcat to 8.5.50 to fix CVE-2019-17563 & CVE-2019-12418

The tomcat version is visible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Jira >=8 on Java 11, a warning message is logged due to an illegal reflection operation by the Apache Felix Framework (org.apache.felix.framework) to method _java.net.URLClassLoader.addURL_

The issue is tracked on Apache Felix at [https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FELIX-5765]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a Jira 8.5.2 instance on Java 11
 # Observe the error messages in the startup logs (_catalina.out_)

h3. Expected Results

No warnings are shown in the log
h3. Actual Results

The below warning is shown in the catalina.out file:
{noformat}
    ___ Starting the JIRA Plugin System _________________
    
WARNING: An illegal reflective access operation has occurred
WARNING: Illegal reflective access by org.apache.felix.framework.ext.ClassPathExtenderFactory$DefaultClassLoaderExtender (file:/Users/allewellyn/jira/atlassian-jira-software-8.5.2-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/org.apache.felix.framework-5.6.12.jar) to method java.net.URLClassLoader.addURL(java.net.URL)
WARNING: Please consider reporting this to the maintainers of org.apache.felix.framework.ext.ClassPathExtenderFactory$DefaultClassLoaderExtender
WARNING: Use --illegal-access=warn to enable warnings of further illegal reflective access operations
WARNING: All illegal access operations will be denied in a future release
{noformat}
There is no currently identified appreciable effect on Jira, but, there may be in a future release of Java (_All illegal access operations will be denied in a future release)_
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Illegal reflection on URLClassLoader by Apache Felix warnings are logged on Java 11

h3. Issue Summary

Similar to JRASERVER-62072, scheduled Jobs will be lost track of when a database operation fails at the moment the job is claimed by the Scheduler. When connectivity resumes, these jobs will not run again. This seems to be a regression as the Caesium Recovery Job does not bring jobs back to their functioning state.

This seems to affect both Jira Server and Data Center but a DC instance can recover from this after time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Schedule a Job such as a mail handler.
 # Interrupt database connectivity to the application.

h3. Expected Results
Jira will run the job as soon as connectivity is established back between the database and application.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will not run the job until a restart is performed.

h3. Workaround

Restarting Jira will allow jobs to resume their functions.
fields.summary: Database connectivity issues break scheduled jobs

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the way Jira is designed would treat the Estimates from Parent and Sub-tasks as separate entities. It is possible to have the Estimates from the Sub-tasks calculated in the Parent Task, but this can only be done if the Original Estimate is set in the Sub-tasks, which will be added into the Parent Task.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Estimates from Parent Task to be calculated against the Logged Work in Sub-tasks without setting the Original Estimate in the Sub-tasks. This would allow users to easily track the Work logs using Parent Task's Original Estimate and count it against the Sub-tasks' Logged Work.

h3. Workaround 
Create the Parent Task without any Estimates. Then in each Sub-tasks, allocate the Estimates. This would be calculated in the Parent Task as long as the 'Include sub-tasks' option is enabled.
fields.summary: Allow Original Estimates of Parent Task to be calculated against Logged Work in Sub-tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some filters with '_' characters cannot be found while searching for filters while creating a board. Ex. "MY_Filter_search" cannot be found while "MY filter search" can be found. It happens for all users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Boards - > Manage board. Click create board.
 # Board from a existing saved filter
 Select one of the available filters such as
 ma_test_filter
 Mya_Test_Filter
 pa_test_filter
 x_filter_test
 zz_filter_test

You will notice that typing ‘mya_’ or ‘zz_’ or ‘x_’ finds the filter. But searching ‘pa_’ or ‘ma_’ or ‘my_’ does not return any result. The endpoint /rest/greenhopper/1.0/savedfilter/list.json?query=MY_&_=1577992092564_ used in finding the saved filters returns only 20 filter results at a time. This number of filter results is hardcoded and not customizable. So if the users have a number of filters with 'MY' stemming word, filters with 'MY_' are never found and it reports no search results found, since the 'MY_ is pushed below the first 20 results.
h3. Expected Results

Search returns the filter matching the pattern.
h3. Actual Results

It throws 'No matches' found
h3. Workaround

You may still be able to search for filter names with no underscore characters by providing the entire filter name, even if it does not appear in the first 20 results. It would require to rename the filters with the underscore to a name without any underscores for those stem words which can have more than 20 results.
fields.summary: Filter search for creating board from existing filter does not work in some cases

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Starting in February 2020, Chrome version 80 (and later Firefox and IE as well) will start enforcing different requirements on cross-site cookies:
 * The new secure-by-default model assumes all cookies should be protected from external access unless otherwise specified. Developers must use a new cookie setting, `_SameSite=None_`, to designate cookies for cross-site access.
 * With Chrome 80 will treat cookies that have no declared SameSite value as `_SameSite=Lax_` cookies.

Warning from the console:
 !Chrome_XSRF_error.png|thumbnail! 
Reference [https://blog.chromium.org/2019/10/developers-get-ready-for-new.html] for full details on the change in Chrome's behavior.

With this new functionality enabled in Chrome, functionalities such as (not limited to)
 * _Confluence's avatars_ in the activity stream (see JRASERVER-70419)
 * _Issue collectors_ embedded in external websites will stop working - Fixed (/) JRASERVER-70494

h3. Suggested Solution

As a Jira Administrator, I would like to be able to configure `SameSite` policy for Jira (None, Lax, Strict). With a reasonable secure default.
h3. Workaround
 * Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior within Jira. 
 * Disable `SameSite` change at Chrome as described in [Turning off Google Chrome SameSite Cookie Enforcement|https://support.siteimprove.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360007364778-Turning-off-Google-Chrome-SameSite-Cookie-Enforcement].
 * Add cookie headers (SameSite=None) at Tomcat level, Tomcat 8.5.42 introduced a global same-site cookie setting in the default _Rfc6265CookieProcessor_.  Check [Tomcat and Jetty SameSite Workarounds|https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/DEV/Tomcat+and+Jetty+SameSite+Workarounds] for more details
 * Add cookie headers at the proxy level:
 ** For example, if using HAProxy, set _SameSite=None_ and explicitly add _Secure_ as it's required (credit to [~ov3]):
{code:java}
http-response replace-header Set-Cookie ^(.*) \1;\ SameSite=None;\ Secure
{code}

 ** Likewise for F5, an iRule can be utilized:
{code:java}
# Set SameSite attribute for the JSESSIONID cookie to "lax"
when HTTP_RESPONSE {
    if {[HTTP::cookie exists "JSESSIONID"]}{
        HTTP::cookie attribute "JSESSIONID" remove {samesite}
        HTTP::cookie attribute "JSESSIONID" insert {samesite} "lax"
    }
}
{code}
fields.summary: Implement SameSite policy support

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
_Basic authentication_ for REST API call has a performance overhead. There are a couple of things which contribute to that:
* Authentication itself, also a possible roundtrip to LDAP/AD/Crowd server
* Updating (refreshing) user attributes from LDAP
* Updating login attempt data _recordLoginAttempt_ 
* Updating UserAttrubutes with updateLastLoginTime
* EventPublishing Security event

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to configure automation (service) user account which has fewer actions during login (auth):
* Doesn't update Login counter for every successful login (possibly every X requests)
* Doesn't update LastLoginTime for every login
* Doesn't update user attributes from LDAP for every login (example {{updateUserFromRemoteDirectory}} method) 

+Possible solution:+
OAuth 2.0 authorization via tokenization should allow for users to self generate a token in order to provide a secure and easy way to integrate their apps at a project level. Tokens should be associated with the corresponding user account limiting permission to the platform based upon the user's access.
 
h3. Note
Make sure that service account doesn't have Jira Admin privileges. In addition to having a security risk, it also has an extra performance overhead due to processing {{removeDismissFlagForUser}}.

h3. Workaround 
Try to avoid _Basic authentication_ for each REST API call, instead try to use _cookie-based authentication_ 

This is how cookie-based authentication works in Jira at a high level:
* The client creates a new session for the user via the Jira REST API.
* Jira returns a session object that has information about the session including the session cookie. The client stores this session object.
* The client can now set the cookie in the header for all subsequent requests to the Jira REST API. 

More details: https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/cookie-based-authentication/
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator I want to configure user accounts for integration jobs with low login overhead

h3. Problem Definition
In JRASERVER-68806 {{EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister}} cache size was decreased from infinite to 10
Based on the problem from JRASERVER-70397, in some cases, the cache that holds values for the last 10 issues is constantly being reloaded, which makes it practically as there is no cache.

h3. Suggested Solution
Increase the default cache size for {{EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister}} cache to hold a large number of issues. Suggested value _1000_. 

h3. Workaround 
Increase the cache size manually, see JRASERVER-70397
fields.summary: Increase the default cache size for customfield.values cache

fields.description:
In Agile boards (scrum, kanban) users have the feature to flag the issue, or flag and comment on the issue. The users would like to make use of the functionality along with workflow transitions, so whenever an issue is flagged it should moved to a blocked state, and when the flag is removed it should be back to TODO status. (However they should be able to configure this using conditions or post functions).

+*Customer Use Case:*+

Suppose if we are adding the add flag option from the issue it should go to other state name as "Blocked" or if the flag is removed it should go to "To do" state.
fields.summary: Ability to change the status of the ticket when it is flagged

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a workflow, the action "Publish" is translated to "Kassera Utkast" in Swedish, which means "Discard Draft".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Under Administration>Settings>Internationalization: Change the default language to "svenska (Sverige)".
 # Under Admnistration>Issues>Workflows: Try to edit a workflow.

h3. Expected Results

You should see two buttons, one to publish and one to disregard the draft.
h3. Actual Results

Both buttons show "Kassera Utkast" which means "Discard Draft".

!Swedish_Bug.png|width=196,height=88!
h3. Workaround

Follow the steps in [Install a custom language pack for Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/install-a-custom-language-pack-for-jira-server-295305642.html] to correct the translation.
 # Download the jar file for swedish language.
 # Unpack the Jar file.
 # Open the file jira-project-config-plugin_sv_SE.properties and modify the following line:
*admin.draft.action.publish=Kassera utkast*
 # Pack everything back into a jar file.
 # Upload the jar file using Jira plugin manager.
fields.summary: Wrong translation in Swedish language pack
