fields.description:
Atlassian products must support *Right to Left languages.* No one is asking anything more than RTL data entry support. All the {color:#FF0000}+Atlassian editors support RTL but once data is saved into the database it is viewed back as LTR and formatting lost.+{color} This is a *bug* in the application to database architecture - more than a feature request.

 

It's an essential requirement. Can't get more basic than this!
fields.summary: RIGHT TO LEFT TEXT

fields.description:
Please would it be possible to add "pre-function" to the workflow engine?

It would help in some cases that are not possible to do now or in very complicated way.

The main purpose is here:

1) defautl value created in workflow not in custom field

To create default value make much more sense in workflow action (before or after the screen is shown to user).

It makes sense for example for custom field "division", when we put some default value for each user and for each issue type diffrent. Then this is shown to user and the user still has the possibility to change it. 

This cannot be done in post-functions.

2) delete the field value before the user can put the own value.

3) you can add the logic here because you could use functions simmilar like in post-functions. So you can do nerly every conditions before you put some values to the fields.

Best Regards
fields.summary: Add workflow "pre-function"

fields.description:
As a Jira admin, I want to have an easier way to set the flag -XX:+UseG1GC when using Java 11+

h3. Problem Definition
Java 11 no longer supports some GC parameters that were supported in Java 8, such as:
{noformat}
-XX:+PrintGCDetails
-XX:+PrintGCDateStamps
-XX:+PrintGCTimeStamps
-XX:+PrintGCCause
-XX:+UseGCLogFileRotation
-XX:NumberOfGCLogFiles=5
-XX:GCLogFileSize=20M
-Xloggc:<PATH_TO_GC_LOGS>
{noformat}

Because of that, we now have the script {{JIRA_INSTALL/bin/set-gc-params.sh}} to detect the currently used Java version and apply the correct flags. However, when using Java 11 we set {{-XX:+UseParallelGC}} by default:
{noformat:title=JIRA_INSTALL/bin/set-gc-params.sh}
#!/bin/sh

GC_JVM_PARAMETERS=""

if [ $java_version -ge 9 ]
then
    # In Java 9, GC logging has been re-implemented using the Unified GC logging framework.
    # See http://openjdk.java.net/jeps/158 or https://docs.oracle.com/javase/10/jrockit-hotspot/logging.htm
    GC_JVM_PARAMETERS="-Xlog:gc*:file=$LOGBASEABS/logs/atlassian-jira-gc-%t.log:time,uptime:filecount=5,filesize=20M ${GC_JVM_PARAMETERS}"
    GC_JVM_PARAMETERS="-XX:+UseParallelGC ${GC_JVM_PARAMETERS}"
else
    # Set the JVM arguments used to start JIRA. For a description of the options, see
    # http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/tech/vmoptions-jsp-140102.html

    #-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    # This allows us to actually debug GC related issues by correlating timestamps
    # with other parts of the application logs.
    #-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    GC_JVM_PARAMETERS="-XX:+PrintGCDetails -XX:+PrintGCDateStamps -XX:+PrintGCTimeStamps -XX:+PrintGCCause ${GC_JVM_PARAMETERS}"
    GC_JVM_PARAMETERS="-Xloggc:$LOGBASEABS/logs/atlassian-jira-gc-%t.log -XX:+UseGCLogFileRotation -XX:NumberOfGCLogFiles=5 -XX:GCLogFileSize=20M ${GC_JVM_PARAMETERS}"
fi

CATALINA_OPTS="${GC_JVM_PARAMETERS} ${CATALINA_OPTS}"
export CATALINA_OPTS
{noformat}

If *{{-XX:+UseG1GC}}* is set, the JVM will fail to start with the following error:
{noformat}
Error occurred during initialization of VM
Multiple garbage collectors selected
{noformat}


h3. Suggested Solutions
* Check if another garbage collector has been specified, and don't set *{{-XX:+UseParallelGC}}* in this case.
* No longer set *{{-XX:+UseParallelGC}}* by default.

 
h3. Workaround 
# Manually remove the flag *{{-XX:+UseParallelGC}}* from *{{JIRA_INSTALL/bin/set-gc-params.sh}}*.
# Follow the steps in the KB article [Setting properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-938847831.html] to add the following Java flag to *{{JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS}}* in the file *{{JIRA_INSTALL/bin/setenv.sh}}:*
{code:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
-XX:+UseG1GC
{code}
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I want to have an easier way to set the flag -XX:+UseG1GC when using Java 11+

fields.description:
h2. Problem
[Connecting Jira applications to MySQL - Jira 7.11|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0711/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-955167744.html] tells that it's needed to set *utf8* collation while having MySQL 5.7 with Jira 7.x whereas [Connecting Jira applications to MySQL 5.7 - Jira 8.5|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-5-7-966063305.html] says that it's needed to use *utf8mb4* which includes a change within *my.ini* file regarding *character_set_server* parameter.
For the customers who have more than one Jira environments on the same database with *utf8* collation and if they want to upgrade one of them (let's say staging environment) to Jira 8, it gives an error regarding the database collation and upgrade is aborted.

h2. Suggested Solution
Ignore the warning and continue to upgrade

h2. Workaround Solution
Setting *character_set_server* parameter to *utf8mb4* within *my.ini* file.
fields.summary: Upgrade shouldn't be aborted from Jira7 to Jira8 if MySQL Database Collation is utf8

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If Jira issue has a datetime value set to 1970-01-01 00:00:00, Jira wouldn't index it:

{noformat}2020-01-06 15:09:29,156 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 WARN [c.a.j.i.i.indexers.impl.DateCustomFieldIndexer] Unable to index custom date field 'End Date/Time(customfield_13225) with value: 0{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a datetime value to 1970-01-01 00:00:00 with API.

h3. Expected Results
# Jira indexes the field

h3. Actual Results
# Jira warns out.

h3. Workaround

Update the datetime value and set it to any date greater than 1970-01-01 00:00:00.
fields.summary: Jira does not index date time values of 1970-01-01 00:00:00

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing another user's profile, the current user's avatar changes. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create another user with a different avatar
# Access this URL ( update the username ):
#* https://jira.mnemonic.no/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=<USERID>

h3. Expected Results
The current user's avatar should not change. 

h3. Actual Results
Their profile picture is shown in the rightmost icon on the navbar, where the current user settings and profiles are located. 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The issue was raised in the community  : https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Viewing-other-user-s-profile-makes-their-profile-picture-appear/qaq-p/1263397

The avatar gets reverted to the proper one, once the visitor user navigates from the profile page.
fields.summary: View of someone 'User Profile' - my own avatar is changing.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary: Quick search does not show results based on issue key for as you type feature. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: In quick search box, start typing the issue key. 
 # Step 2: The results will have NO Results found entries.

h3. Expected Results

The customer does expect to see similar issues in the results. This is better for the user experience. 
h3. Workaround

Users can enter the entire issue key and click enter to jump to the issue.
fields.summary: Quick search to include issue key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This issue has been discussed in with Atlassian Support, and Atlassian has stated that there are currently no plans to fix this issue. Creating this bug report so there is a user-facing record that this has been discussed.

The problem:
We have Subversion repositories indexed in Fisheye. When log messages for Subversion commits include Jira issue keys, those commits show up in the Development panel for those issues.

Our Subversion users have the ability to change log messages. If a Jira issue key is added or removed from a Subversion log message after-the-fact, and the revprops for that revision are re-scanned in Fisheye to pull in those changes, Fisheye updates appropriately, but Jira does not always update appropriately. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

More specifically, to describe the behavior we have seen:

If we add a Jira issue key to a log message that has already been pulled into Fisheye, and that new Jira issue already has commits in the development panel, that commit will show up on that issue (though the "# commits" link doesn't update to the correct number)
If we do the same thing, but with a Jira issue that doesn't have any commits associated with it already, the commit never ends up showing on the Jira issue

h3. Workaround
The only workaround for this is to modify the database, which is not a good/safe practice for a production environment.

h3. Expected Results

The issue works as expected.

h3. Actual Results

Described in the steps to reproduce.
fields.summary: Changing commit message does not reflect in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
As per JRASERVER-47271, when nesting groups with multiple directories, relationships between groups are only created for the first directory server listed under 'User Directories'. This means these memberships won't be applied for all other directories.

h3. Suggested resolution
We suggest replicating the nested group memberships across groups coming from other directories on the list, so that we have consistent situation.
fields.summary: Apply nested group relationships across all corresponding groups coming from all directories in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Ability to scroll down to choose more filters when adding a gadget related to filters E.g Filter results gadget.

The gadget only shows the first 10 filters, in the drop-down menu. I f you want to choose other filters then you will have to click on Advanced Search and choose it from there.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have more than 10 favourite filters
# Add a gadget related to filters E.g "Filter Results" Gadget.
# Click on the drop-down menu to choose a saved filter for the gadget.
# You will only get the first 10 filters and not all 12 filters.
# You want a filter that is not in that list, you will have to click on "Advance Search" and choose it from there.

h3. Expected Results
The drop-down menu should have all filters and give the user the ability to scroll down to choose the filter.
h3. Actual Results
Only the first 10 filters are visible in the list instead of all filters.

h3. Workaround

You want a filter that is not in that list, you will have to click on "Advance Search" and choose it from there.
fields.summary: Ability to scroll down to choose more filters when adding a gadget related to filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Create and Edit issue screens may fail to render in Jira if an user-picker field is displayed and the default value is set to an user that has been deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an user-picker field and set an user as the default value
 # Delete the user that has been set as default
# Attempt to edit an issue or create an issue that makes use of the user-picker field.

h3. Expected Results
Create and Edit issue screens containing this field should continue to display properly and allow users to change value to a different user as needed.

h3. Actual Results
Screens fail to render and the field cannot be edited.  This may result in blank screens or just the field itself will not render.

h3. Workaround
* Re-create the user
* Then change the default field value

If it is the case that there are many fields and it is not known which fields have set the default value, then we can use this database query:
{code}
SELECT customfield.id, customfield.cfname,genericconfiguration.*
FROM customfield JOIN fieldconfiguration ON fieldconfiguration.fieldid = 'customfield_'||customfield.id
JOIN genericconfiguration ON genericconfiguration.datakey = CAST (fieldconfiguration.id as varchar(60)) 
Where genericconfiguration.xmlvalue like '<string>deletedusername</string>' ;
{code}
fields.summary: User Picker fields may cause Issue Actions to Fail if Default Value is set to Deleted User

fields.description:
Whenever you remove an application license through the *Versions & licenses* page, you are prompted to select whether you want to remove the application's configuration or not. 

The option to remove it is marked by default and that could cause issues in specific situations, such as changing Server licenses for Data Center licenses.

It would be great to leave that option unmarked by default to avoid removing application settings by mistake.
fields.summary: Change the default option to remove an application's configuration when removing its license.

fields.description: Within the Jira Portfolio plug-in, when creating a new Plan or editing the Issue Sources for an existing plan, I'd like the ability to add an _{color:#de350b}inverse{color}_ issue filter. Basically, my idea is that any issue returned by the {color:#de350b}_inverse_{color} issue filter would be excluded from the Plan, even if it would've otherwise been included based on the other Issue Sources in the plan. This would make creation of plans from large, messy projects (especially those migrated from other systems such as Rally) much easier because users would no longer need to manually find and exclude old, never completed "junk" from the Plan as long as they could wite JQL that would return them.
fields.summary: Allow me to use JQL to exclude issues from a Jira Portfolio Plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira datacenter when a task is scheduled it could be picked up by any node. So there is no task affinity to a specific node. 
 
There are cases when a small Jira instance can handle all web traffic and only some tasks require more resources (due to heave processing required only for that execution). 
That makes scaling of the environment hard, since it requires all nodes to be equal.  

h3. Suggested Solution
Able to dedicate resource extensive tasks to a non-user facing node aka task affinity.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: As a Jira DC Administrator I want to be able to run scheduled tasks at specific nodes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Find app through the application is not searching on the market place.

Environment: 
 Jira 8.5 / 8.6
 UPM 4.0.8
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Administration
 # Managed Apps
 # Find new Apps
 # Try to search for any application.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should be able to retrieve the result from the marketplace.
h3. Actual Results

Jira can't retrieve any results.
h3. Workaround

Download the application through the [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/] and upload the Jar file through the UI.
fields.summary: 'Find new apps' doesn't return any result.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some plugins' dependency versions get unexpectedly overridden by OSGi – e.g. the "Better PDF Exporter for Jira" app gets Guava v26 even that it requires (and bundles) Guava v10.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Get a clean Jira 8.5.2
 # Install "Better PDF Exporter for Jira" app
 # Go to Jira Administration -> OSGi
 # Search for "com.midori.jira.plugin.pdfview"
 # Expand "Import-Package" block
 # Search for "com.google.common.base" 

h3. Expected Results

No "com.google.common.base" present on the "Import-Package" list
h3. Actual Results

"com.google.common.base version: [26.0.0,26.0.0]" is present on the "Import-Package" list

h3. Note
Jira _8.5.1_ is not affected 

h3. Workaround
Replace WEB-INF/lib/atlassian-plugins-osgi-5.3.3.jar file with atlassian-plugins-osgi-5.2.2.jar from previous Jira version
fields.summary: Some plugins' dependency versions get unexpectedly overridden

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira 8.6.0, even though the groups are active, checking under the *Project setting>User and Roles*, the groups are showing inactive as shown in the screenprint attached.

This can be replicated and seen right after installing the Jira 8.6.0. Even the default local jira-administrator group is shown as inactive. Checking the Group status in the Jira DB, it shows the group as active, so this appears to be false positive.
h3. Workaround

Switch off the feature flag: 
jira.users.and.roles.page.in.react
fields.summary: Jira 8.6.0: All Groups are showing inactive under the Project setting>User and Roles

fields.description:
h4. Problem:

{{NodeReindexServiceThread}} is capable of entering a state where it is no longer checking messages. This can cause inconsistency between JIRA Data Center Nodes.
h4. Customer situation:

In a standby environment, during the cutover, the snapshot was recovered but NodeReindexServiceThread was not checking messages, causing the nodes to get behind.
h4. Environment
 * JIRA Data Center

h4. Expected Results

{{NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1}} *Timed_waiting* in a parkNanos state, sleeping until wake up to check messages again:
{code:java|title=node2}
"NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1" #128 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f8feb238800 nid=0x8379 waiting on condition [0x00007f8fd1bf9000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000006869304c0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:215)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.awaitNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2078)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:1093)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:809)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1074)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1134)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}
h4. What was observed instead:
 * Thread dumps showed that {{NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1}} was *Waiting* in a park state:

{code:java|title=node1}
"NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1" #110 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007ff06f215800 nid=0x18f46 waiting on condition [0x00007ff04b429000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x0000000686202370> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:1081)
	at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:809)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1074)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1134)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}
h4. Perceived results:
 * Health Check detects that index data is behind the Database date and reports the delay, that keeps increasing as {{NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1}} is not getting the messages.

h4. Notes

As part of Lucene changes in Jira 8.x, code was improved in this area, which makes the problem less likely to occur, eg. {{com.atlassian.jira.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService#reIndex}} now catches the *Throwable* exception.
h4. Workaround:
 * Stop Jira in all nodes at the same time
 * Start the first node. Wait until the snapshot is restored and then restart the node.
 * After the restart and after NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 updates the index, start the second node
 * If there are more nodes, start them sequentially.
fields.summary: NodeReindexServiceThread can stop checking messages

fields.description:
In order to connect our Gmail account to the Jira Mail Handler, now we have to set the "Allow less secure app access" to be ON and use username and password to log in, which makes our Google account not secure enough. However, this way won't work anymore in the near future, since Google decided to change their authentication rules lately:

[https://gsuiteupdates.googleblog.com/2019/12/less-secure-apps-oauth-google-username-password-incorrect.html]
{quote}Access to LSAs will be turned off in two stages:
 * *After June 15, 2020* - Users who try to connect to an LSA for the first time will no longer be able to do so. This includes third-party apps that allow password-only access to Google calendars, contacts, and email via protocols such as CalDAV, CardDAV, IMAP, and Exchange ActiveSync (Google Sync). Users who have connected to LSAs prior to this date will be able to continue using them until usage of all LSAs is turned off. 
 * *After February 15, 2021 -* Access to LSAs will be turned off for all G Suite accounts. {quote}
Could you please let me know your plan about this?
fields.summary: Improve the incoming email handler to connect to Gmail with OAuth

fields.description: Within the Jira Portfolio plug-in, when creating a new Plan or editing the Issue Sources for an existing plan, I'd like the ability to add an _{color:#de350b}inverse{color}_ issue filter. Basically, my idea is that any issue returned by the {color:#de350b}_inverse_{color} issue filter would be excluded from the Plan, even if it would've otherwise been included based on the other Issue Sources in the plan. This would make creation of plans from large, messy projects (especially those migrated from other systems such as Rally) much easier because users would no longer need to manually find and exclude old, never completed "junk" from the Plan as long as they could wite JQL that would return them.
fields.summary: Allow me to use JQL to exclude issues from a Jira Portfolio Plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There are several cases where users accidentally deleted a project in Jira and needed to recover them from the XML backup. This can be a taxing process to do as Project Import requires the [many pre-requisites|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/restoring-a-project-from-backup-938847691.html#Restoringaprojectfrombackup-prepareJIRAPreparingyourtargetJirainstance] to meet.

In a situation where a deleted project was from 30 days ago and Jira has gone through a number of changes (scheme cleanup, plugin updates), the Project Import to restore won't be as smooth. Work has to be done to restore the old XML Backup to a temporary instance, set it up, then create a new XML backup to be used to Project Import to Jira.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Option 1: "Delete Project" action to archive the project for 90 days (or configurable X days) before deleting the project from Jira
* Option 2: "Delete Project" action will _only_ appear on Archived projects
* Option 3: (Works with Server) "Delete Project" to have Trash bin with retention policy
 
h3. Workaround 
The only way to recover a deleted project is to use Project Import feature from an XML backup.
fields.summary: Prevent Accidental Deletion of Projects
